CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01A15

SHORT_DESCR.P: The procurement of extension works to four existing PFI Schools in Leicester in order to provide additional school places at each Schools, those Schools currently being governed by 2 on-going PFI Project Agreements entered into in 2007 and 2012 respectively.

The Council entered into a PFI (Private Finance Initiative) Project Agreement on 19.12.2007 (‘PFI 1’) pursuant to its Building Schools for the Future Programme (‘BSF’) for the new build and operation of 2 Schools. It subsequently entered into a further PFI Project Agreement on 30.3.2012 (‘PFI 2’) for 2 further Schools. Due to an unforeseen demand for additional school places and given the Council's statutory duty to ensure sufficiency of school places in Leicester, it has been determined that the most viable and cost effective route is to structurally extend the four PFI Schools in order to meet forthcoming pupil demand. Pursuant to their exclusive rights under their contractual arrangements to carry out structural alterations to the existing PFI Schools, the Council is now looking to instruct the existing Contractor for PFI 1 and separately the Contractor for PFI 2 to build the extensions to the 4 Schools through the instigation of an Authority Change.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: As set out within the Authority Change Process under the existing PFI Agreements

AC_COST.AC_CRITERION: As set out within the Authority Change Process under the existing PFI Agreements

INFO_ADD.P: The Council will enter into a Deed of Variation to PFI 1 and PFI 2 with each of the PFI Companies described in section V.2). The PFI Companies will be required to appoint a building contractor (approx. value 14 800 000 GBP), vary the existing FM Agreements relating to PFI 1 and PF 2 (approx. value 11 000 000 GBP) appoint the Design Team (approx. value 800 000 GBP) appoint an Employer Agent/QS (approx. value 180 000 GBP).

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Under each of PFI 1 and PFI 2 the Council is prohibited from making any Alterations to the PFI Schools (meaning alterations of a structural nature) outside of the PFI arrangements. Instead it is required under those contractual arrangements to issue an Authority Change Notice separately under PFI and PFI 2. On this basis each of the PFI Contractors, under PFI 1 and PFI 2 have exclusive rights to carry out additional works of the nature now required by the Council. On this basis, the Council considers that that award of this contract (which will be documented by way of a Deed of Variation to each of PFI and PFI 2 respectively) is permitted without prior publication pursuant to Regulation 32 (2) (b) (iii) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015/Article 32 2 (b) (iii) of Directive 2014/24/EU of the Europen Parliament and of the Council. Furthermore, the Authority Change will require the PFI 1 Contractor and the PFI 2 Contractor to separately enter into the following contractual arrangements in order to facilitate the delivery of the proposed works and services under the Authority Change Notice(s): (a) Appointment of a building contractor (approx. value 14 800 000 GBP), (b) Deed of Variation to the existing FM Agreements under PFI 1 and PFI 2 (approx. value 11 000 000 GBP) (c) Appointment of the design team (approx. value 800 000 GBP) and (d) Appointment of the Employers Agent and Quantity Surveyor (approx. value 180 000 GBP). The Council considers that as these appointments are being made as between the PFI Contractors and each respective Sub-Contractor and/or Professional Team member, they fall outside of the remit of the Public Contracts Regulations/Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.OFFICIALNAME: Leicester BSF Company 1 Limited and Leicester BSF Company 2 Limited
ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Third Floor, Broad Quay House, Prince Street

INFO_ADD_SUBCONTRACTING.P: The PFI Companies will firstly sub-contract the build phase of the proposed extensions to a building contractor which is currently scheduled to be appointed in May 2017. Once built, the PFI Companies will extend the appointment of the existing FM Contractor to maintain the extensions in line with existing PFI Schools in accordance with the existing PFI arrangements.
